mil.navy.nrl.cmf.sousa
Class EntityFSM

java.lang.Object
  mil.navy.nrl.cmf.sousa.EntityFSM
All Implemented Interfaces:
Clock.AlarmHandler, Selectable.Handler
Direct Known Subclasses:
ClientSideFSM, ServerSideFSM
public abstract class EntityFSM
extends Object
implements Selectable.Handler, Clock.AlarmHandler

EntityFSM is an abstractv class that contains all common information about a single instance of the Entity's as a client or server. An EntityFSM object includes the following state information:

  • P2PChannel control channel
  • EntityFSM.State representing the current state of the FSM
  • LinkedList serving as the outbound queue
  • boolean deathWarrant indicating the FSM is about to be freed

Version:
$Id: EntityFSM.java,v 1.5 2006/01/31 16:09:44 bilal Exp $
Author:
Bilal Khan, David Talmage

Method Detail

dispatch

final EntityFSM.State dispatch(Selectable sel,
                               SignalType st,
                               EntityFSM.State state)
Handle a signal from a Selectable object by asking the State to do something within this context. Base writing functionality: takes from the outQ and writes. Base reading functionality: messages read are dispatched to the state for handling.

Parameters:
sel - the Selectable
st - the Signal
state - the State
Returns:
the new EntityFSM.State

scheduleWrite

final void scheduleWrite(Serializable ser)
Schedule the writing of a serializable on the control channel. How is this implemented? We put the message in the outbound queue, break select, causing it to rebuild the selectableset so that the control channel of this FSM is included in the write set.

Parameters:
ser - the serializable object to write.

flushThenKill

final void flushThenKill()
Wait until the outQ is empty, then kill this FSM. This method must be called repeatedly--once in each call to handle(), until the FSM is killed (deregistered from the Focus/Nimbus) at which point it will cease to get time.

attemptKill

abstract void attemptKill()
Attempt to kill this FSM.

wakeup

abstract void wakeup()
Interrupt the Entity thread, thereby breaking it's select()

deregister

abstract void deregister()
Disconnect this FSM because the underlying p2pchannel is dead.
